title: Current induced in a loop inside the coil

content.question: A loop of wire of radius <math alttext="lowercase r equals 5 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mtext> cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and resistance <math alttext="uppercase R sub L equals 2 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is inserted into the coil, as shown above. The power supply is adjusted so that the magnitude of the magnetic field <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the coil as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="B of t equals, beta plus alpha t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>β</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>α</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="beta equals 25 microteslas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>β</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mtext> μT</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="alpha equals 12 microteslas per second" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mi>α</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>12</mn> <mtext> μT</mtext> <mo>/</mo> <mtext>s</mtext> </mrow> </math>. The current induced in the loop is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="3.7 times 10 to the negative 6 power, amperes" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> A</mtext></math>

<math alttext="2.0 times 10 to the negative 6 power, amperes" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> A</mtext></math>

<math alttext="5.2 times 10 to the negative 7 power, amperes" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> A</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.9 times 10 to the negative 7 power, amperes" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> A</mtext></math>

<math alttext="4.7 times 10 to the negative 8 power, amperes" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> A</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4.7 times 10 to the negative 8 power, amperes" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> A</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
